title: 820-3115-B green light no power no chaege.
message:
ppbus_g3h - 12.57
pp3v42 - 3.460
pp18v_dcin_connector - 18.9
Q7055 + Q7630 + Q7080 replaced but no go..
not turning on in SMC mode.

title: 820-3115-B green light no power no chaege.

message:

no pp3v3_s5 present and no liquid or anything special historie to it, simply died.
u5010 gives 3.294

message:

title: 820-3115-B green light no power no chaege.
message: Inject 3V and see what heats up. Shorts on 3V bus are the worst usually :(

title: 820-3115-B green light no power no chaege.
message: Ok so I injected 3v to the rail and found U9000 heating up and replaced it but at first attempt I didn't noticed that the magsafe was connected and caused the green light to go off and probably some more damage, It was a minute before closing time so I didn't check where the damage could be but any ideas from your experience will be helpful.

title: 820-3115-B green light no power no chaege.
message:
I lost pp3v42 so i went thorough "3.425V "G3Hot" Supply"  page 63 and it stoppes at U6990 pin 9 dont exsist and seems shorted to ground, same for c6999, c6994 and L6995 shows nothing, I replaced all her mentioned with no luck..could use some help here, when i injected 3.4 to c6994 U6990 got the ipa off but never got realy hot.
remember that i had before pp3v42 i missed pp3v3_s5 and injected when magsafe on in a mistake that what caused pp3v42 to go.

title: 820-3115-B green light no power no chaege.
message: So 3V42 is shorted to GND? Inject 3V and see what heats up, SMC is first suspect, PCH etc.

message: yes smc reacts immidiatly, missed that one.. to the garbage?

title: 820-3115-B green light no power no chaege.
message: Well, SMC is dead at least...up to you if you want to replace and continue.
